readme.summary: Excellent clarity and examples with conversational style, but lacks modern installation methods, configuration details, and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Installation instructions only show manual tarball extraction instead of pip install, which is the standard and expected method for PyPI packages

common_complaints: Missing wheel distributions for multiple Python versions and architectures (3.7, 3.8, 3.9, aarch64)
Build failures and compilation errors across platforms (Windows, macOS Big Sur, RHEL)
Incomplete network data returned (missing routes, netmask/broadcast for link-local addresses)
Incorrect gateway selection logic (picks highest metric instead of lowest)
Installation requires build tools despite being a C extension without pre-built wheels
sentiment.summary: The project is effectively abandoned with an explicit maintainer departure notice (May 2021), no active maintenance, accumulating unresolved issues spanning 5+ years, and critical infrastructure gaps (missing wheels) that create installation friction for users.

concerns: No commits in over 4.5 years (last commit May 2021)

No closed issues in past 6 months
No merged pull requests in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months

langchain-experimental.name: langchain-experimental
langchain-experimental.description: Building applications with LLMs through composability

cves.summary: langchain-experimental vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution
LangChain Experimental vulnerable to arbitrary code execution
langchain_experimental vulnerable to arbitrary code execution via PALChain in the python exec method
langchain_experimental Code Execution via Python REPL access

Versions of the package langchain-experimental from 0.0.15 and before 0.0.21 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution when retrieving values from the database, the code will attempt to call 'eval' o

langchain_experimental (aka LangChain Experimental) before 0.0.61 for LangChain provides Python REPL access without an opt-in step. NOTE; this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-27
langchain_experimental 0.0.14 allows an attacker to bypass the CVE-2023-36258 fix and execute arbitrary code via the PALChain in the python exec method.
